intro: Hieracium fallens, commonly known as the fall sow-thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a rosette of basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers from June to September, arranged in a single terminal head. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a slightly bitter taste, while its flowers attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium fallens thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in waste areas.
